CVNN¶

class CvnnModel¶
__init__(self, learning_rate=0.001, tensorboard=True, verbose=True, automatic_restore=True)¶

Constructor

Parameters

  • name – Name of the model. It will be used to distinguish models

  • shape – List of cvnn.layers.ComplexLayer objects

  • loss_fun – tensorflow.python.keras.losses to be used.

  • verbose – if True it will print information of the model just created

  • tensorboard –

    If True it will save tensorboard information inside log/.../tensorboard_logs/

    • Loss and accuracy

    • Graph

    • Weights histogram

  • save_model_checkpoints – Save the model to be able to load and continue training later

  • save_csv_checkpoints – Save information of the train and test loss and accuracy on csv files

Warning

save_model_checkpoints Not yet working.

Train¶

fit(self, x, y, ratio=0.8, learning_rate=0.01, epochs=10, batch_size=32,
verbose=True, display_freq=None, fast_mode=False, save_to_file=True)

Trains the model for a fixed number of epochs (iterations on a dataset).

Parameters

  • x – Input data.

  • y – Labels

  • ratio – Percentage of the input data to be used as train set (the rest will be use as validation set) Default: 0.8 (80% as train set and 20% as validation set)

  • learning_rate – Learning rate for the gradient descent. For the moment only GD is supported.

  • epochs – (uint) Number of epochs to do.

  • batch_size – (uint) Batch size of the data. Default 32 (because keras use 32 so… why not?)

  • verbose – (Boolean) Print results of the training while training

  • display_freq – Frequency on terms of steps for saving information and running a checkpoint. If None (default) it will automatically match 1 epoch = 1 step (print/save information at each epoch)

  • fast_mode – (Boolean) Takes precedence over verbose and save_to_file

  • save_to_file – (Boolean) save a txt with the information of the fit (same as what will be printed if verbose)

Returns

None

Results¶

call(self, x)¶

Forward result of the network

Parameters

x – Data input to be calculated

Returns

Output of the netowrk

predict(self, x)¶

Predicts the value of the class.

Warning

ATTENTION: Use this only for classification tasks. For regression use call method.

Parameters

x – Input

Returns

Prediction of the class that x belongs to.

evaluate_loss(self, x, y)¶

Computes the output of x and computes the loss using y

Parameters

  • x – Input of the netwotk

  • y – Labels

Returns

loss value

evaluate_accuracy(self, x, y)¶

Computes the output of x and returns the accuracy using y as labels

Parameters

  • x – Input of the netwotk

  • y – Labels

Returns

accuracy

evaluate(self, x, y)¶

Compues both the loss and accuracy using evaluate_loss and evaluate_accuracy

Parameters

  • x – Input of the netwotk

  • y – Labels

Returns

tuple (loss, accuracy)

string of the summary of the model

Returns

True if the network is complex. False otherwise.
